content.description: Stand start the face with an incut left hand sidepull and right hand on an almost okay sloper. Find a foot and levitate up to some horizontal rails and take it too the top with a big move to the lip.
content.protection: 3-4 pads. Spotter. The landing isn't great!
content.location: This problem is found in the middle of the tall clean aesthetic face. It joins "September" at the top.

content.description: Crimpy face climb starting on two crimps on the lower left side of the face. Climb trends up and right to the horn at the lip.Â
content.location: On the Easy Gully Boulder starting on two crimps on the lower left side of the face.

content.description:
Stand start the pedestal with a nice right hand jug sidepull and a left hand sloping edge. Pull up to the sloping lip and mantle the pedestal. Once on the pedestal reach up to jugs at the base of the right trending lip/ arete of the tall hourglass shaped boulder.

 Pull on to the wall and climb up and right on the overhanging lip on holds that seem like they should be better. Span out to the opposite arete and make a few compression moves up and a long reach for the juggy lip before mantling above the entire notch.
content.protection: The landing gets worse the higher up. there are two bolts on top of the block to rap and/ or TR. One could fall on the first half and be safe, but a fall at the top or on the mantle would not be good.
content.location: This boulder problem is not on the Easy Gully boulder, but about 60 or 70 yards below it. The giant hourglass shaped rock can't be missed, especially when approaching from the Backyard and Asteroid Boulders.

content.description: Sit start compressing a LH side pull and RH on arete. Make a few moves up the arete and on left sidepulls before gaining the jug on the face at head height. Pop to the lip and rock over straight up. Some trickery makes gaining the jug more controlled, so you don't blow off down the hill.Perhaps something new, if not, let me know. After making the hike up to climb September, I wanted to climb something else while up there, and found this around the arete.
content.location: Around the arete to the left of September

content.description: Sit start with the left hand on the clean aesthetic arete on a sweet palm pinch. Right hand is on a crimp a few feet out right. Figure out some foot beta and move up through a series of small right hand edges and continue up the arete with the left. Make it to the top and find a spot to topout!
content.location: Just to the left of "September" on the elongated face.This problem climbs the obvious left arete from a sit.

pathTokens: Boulders Behind the Main Parking Lot/Visitor Center

content.description:
This is a large boulder up Easy Gully. It is a steep hike, but not relatively long, even with pads.

 This boulder provides the dedicated climber with several great climbs in an aesthetic, exposed and secluded location. The entire Notch is visible from here, making it one of the best spots to take in its beauty.
